resources.string:
" A Photo Manager
Version AndroFotoFinder $versionName$
$about$
$translate$

Minimal requirements: Android 4.0 (API 14), Internet/WiFi connection to download geodata and a SD card to cache geodata and to store photos

Licence: GPLv3

Required permissions:

  • INTERNET: to download map data from Open Street Map Server
  • ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE and ACCESS_WIFI_STATE: to find out if WiFi/Internet is online to start downloading geodata if necessary
  • WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE to cache downloaded map data in local file system and to do file operations.
  • READ_LOGS after app crash the logcat is written to /mnt/sdcard/copy/log/androFotofinder.logcat*.txt .

The code uses

  • App icons desigend by Md Nazmul Hasan (cc) 2018 Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License.
  • osmdroid library to display online maps from Open Street Map
  • Andrid Stringlate app to allow the app user to thranslate this app to other gui-languages
  • mapsforge library to display offline maps
  • chris bane's PhotoView that implemnts the zoomable image view. Using k3b-s extended version with reload on zoom and hugeimage-support) that has not been merged into the original yet
  • Sergey Tarasevich's Android-Universal-Image-Loader for manageing miniatur image previews(thumbnails)
  • k3b-geoHelper for handling geo-uri-s
  • drew noakes metadata-extractor to display extended exif info
  • slf4j logging for java with the https://github.com/lp0/slf4j-android driver
  • junit testing support with Mockito

History

See History.

Links

  • Source code of current version of "a Photo Manager" (A(ndro)FotoFinder) at git repository@github.com
    https://github.com/k3b/APhotoManager/
  • APhotoManager Changelog
  • Source code of osmdroid library at git repository@github.com
    https://github.com/osmdroid/osmdroid
  • slf4j logging for java org.slf4j:slf4j-api
    http://www.slf4j.org/
  • slf4j logging driver for android eu.lp0.slf4j:slf4j-android
    https://github.com/lp0/slf4j-android
  • junit testing support junit:junit
    http://junit.org/
  • Mockito testing support
    https://github.com/mockito/mockito
  • Geographic data comes from Open Street Map
    http://www.openstreetmap.org
  • The GPLv3 license is available at
    http://www.gnu.org/licenses/gpl-3.0

Legal stuff

A Photo Manager (A(ndro)FotoFinder)

Android is a trademark of Google Inc. Use of this trademark is subject to Google Permissions.





"

"

A Photo Manager

with 'A Photo Map' in 'AndroFotoFinder'

Manage local photos: Find/Copy/Edit-Exif and show in Gallery or Map.

Features:
  • Fast \u0009\u0009find photos by \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009tags(keywords), \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009(sub-)folder, date, \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009geographic map, title, rating, ...
  • Display result in \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009gallery or \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009geographic map from openstreetmap.
  • \u0009\u0009Detail view features zooming, swiping for next/previous image.
  • Buildin file manager for photos: find, sort, view, copy, \u0009\u0009delete, send, ... .
  • \u0009\u0009Edit exif metadata: date, title, description, \u0009\u0009 \u0009\u0009tags(keywords), geo, rating, ....
  • Optional Folder-Rule based autoprocessing: \u0009\u0009Photos are automatically renamed and get tags, geo, title, ... when you copy/move them.
  • Mark images as PRIVATE to hide them from other Gallery-Apps and image pickers.
  • In Protected/Pinned Mode \u0009\u0009potetially dangerous app-commands like edit/copy/delete/share/settings/change image selection \u0009\u0009are disabled so you can savley hand over your phone to someone else.
  • Can handle big image collections (20000+ images in 1000+ folders).
  • Uses Android's image content-provider. No initial image scan \u0009\u0009neccessary.
  • Extended photo media scanner for Exif, IPTC, XMP
Required Android Permissions:
  • INTERNET: to download map data from Open Streetmap Server
  • ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE and ACCESS_WIFI_STATE: to find out if \u0009\u0009wifi/internet is online to start downloaded geodata
  • WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE to cache downloaded map data \u0009\u0009in local file system and to do file operations with the photos
  • READ_LOGS to read and save potential crash-logs to a textfile.

"
This software uses map data provided by OpenStreetMap.org

" \u0009App and internet homepage available in these languages:

      • \u0009\u0009\u0009
    • On android through the A Photo Manager menu Settings/Translate using the stringlate app. \u0009\u0009\u0009
      • \u0009\u0009
    \u0009
\u0009"

" Manage local photos: Find/Copy/Edit-Exif and show in Gallery or Map.
Features:
* Fast find photos by tags(keywords), (sub-)folder, date, geo , title, ... * Display result in gallery or geographic map from openstreetmap. * Detail view features zooming, swiping for next/previous image. * Buildin file manager for photos: find, sort, view, copy, delete, send, ... . * Edit exif metadata: date, title, description, tags(keywords), geo, rating, .... * Optional Folder-Rule based autoprocessing: Photos are automatically renamed and get tags, geo, title, ... when you copy/move them * Mark images as PRIVATE to hide them from other Gallery-Apps and image pickers. * In Protected/Pinned Mode potetially dangerous app-commands like edit/copy/delete/share/settings/change image selection are disabled so you can savley hand over your phone to someone else * Can handle big image collections (20000+ images in 1000+ folders). * Uses Android's image content-provider. No initial image scan neccessary. * Extended photo media scanner for Exif, IPTC, XMP
Required Android Permissions:
* INTERNET: to download map data from Open Streetmap Server * ACCESS_NETWORK_STATE and ACCESS_WIFI_STATE: to find out if wifi/internet is online to start downloaded geodata * WRITE_EXTERNAL_STORAGE to cache downloaded map data in local file system and to do file operations with the photos * READ_LOGS to read and save potential crash-logs to a textfile. . "
Changing geo info in selected photos

"\# # Generated with '%1$s' Version %2$s. # # This properties file contain sqlite sql formulas for the context data in the image view in the format # name=sql expression. # # name is the menu title where the sql belongs to. # # for all available columns see the Details label # # '|' will be replaced by newline '\\n' # "
